modules.description: This module provides direct access to the individual fields of a line structure, specifically handling color and content attributes. It enables precise manipulation and traversal of these fields through operations like `map`, `fold`, and `iter`. Use cases include transforming line colors, extracting content strings, or validating field properties in a structured display context.

This module provides operations to manipulate and traverse the color and content fields of a line structure, including functions like `map`, `fold`, and `iter` for transformation and inspection. It works directly with `Line.t`, handling `Color.t` and string values for each field. Concrete use cases include modifying line colors, extracting or validating content strings, and building custom line transformations in display logic.

This module defines layout options for displaying s-expressions, specifically supporting single-column and two-column formats. It provides operations to compare layout variants, list all possible layouts, and convert layout values to s-expressions. These options are used to control the visual formatting of structured data in tools that render s-expressions, such as diff viewers or pretty printers.

This module defines configuration options for controlling the display of s-expressions in the `sexp_diff` library. It provides functions to create and manipulate display settings, including parameters like `collapse_threshold` and `num_shown`, which determine how deeply nested structures are rendered and how many elements are displayed. These options are used to customize the visual output when comparing or formatting s-expressions in tools that consume the `sexp_diff` library.

This module represents pairs of lines that are either the same or different, used to display side-by-side comparisons in a diff viewer. It provides `fst` and `snd` functions to access the individual lines in a pair, handling both identical and divergent line cases. Concrete use cases include rendering line differences in a user interface or generating structured output for diff results.

This module defines a line structure with `color` and `content` fields, providing direct accessors and transformations. It supports operations like mapping over fields, extracting content, and rendering based on color. Use cases include formatting colored output, processing structured display lines, and applying color-specific transformations in diff rendering.

This module defines configuration options for rendering s-expressions, including layout selection and line collapsing behavior. It supports types for display settings and layout variants, enabling precise control over output formatting in diff and pretty-printing tools. Functions allow creating and serializing display options, particularly managing how unchanged line sequences are collapsed during display.

This module provides functions to manipulate and render line pairs with hiding capabilities, such as collapsing or expanding hidden sections. It operates on the `t` type, which represents either a visible line pair, a hidden segment with a count, or all content being hidden. Use cases include rendering diffs with collapsible regions and managing visibility state in a structured display.

This module defines color options for rendering differences in a display, specifically supporting Red, Green, and Plain styles. It provides comparison and serialization functions for these color values. Used to visually distinguish changes in a diff view within a UI library.

This module provides a cache for memoizing intermediate results during the computation of diffs between two S-expressions. It stores mappings between nodes of the original and updated S-expressions to optimize performance by avoiding redundant calculations. The cache is used internally by the diff algorithm to track node relationships efficiently.

This module provides utilities for rendering s-expression diffs with color and structure, handling line pairs, visibility control, and display configuration. It operates on diff data structures to generate display-ready line pairs, supporting features like color coding, line comparison, and collapsible sections. Concrete use cases include building interactive diff viewers and formatting structured comparison output with visual styling and controlled detail levels.

This module computes diffs between two S-expressions by identifying insertions, deletions, and modifications directly on the tree structure, without serialization. It works with `Sexp.t` values and guarantees that applying the resulting diff transforms the original S-expression into the updated one, and vice versa when inverted. It uses a cache to optimize performance during node comparison, particularly effective when S-expressions have similar structures at corresponding depths.

This module represents and manipulates S-expression diffs with operations like adding, deleting, replacing, or enclosing nodes. It supports applying diffs to S-expressions, inverting diffs, and comparing or hashing diff values. Use it to programmatically transform and analyze S-expression structures, such as in code refactoring or configuration diffing.

This module provides functions to render s-expression diffs in various formats, including plain text, ANSI-colored output, and two-column layouts. It operates on `Diff.t` values and uses `Display_options` to control formatting details like line collapsing and layout selection. Use cases include generating human-readable diff outputs for version control tools, pretty-printing configuration changes, and visualizing structured data differences in terminal interfaces.

This module computes and manipulates diffs between S-expressions using tree-structured operations like insertions, deletions, and modifications. It works directly with `Sexp.t` and `Diff.t` values to enable precise transformations, supporting applications such as code refactoring, configuration comparison, and structured data synchronization. The module also renders diffs in customizable formats, including colored and structured terminal output, suitable for tools like version control interfaces and interactive diff viewers.
